description: The asset tag of a rack unit was connected.
bladeTagID is empty if the asset tag is not on a blade extension.

event.Summary: Asset tag ($v14) of rack unit $v10 connected

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetTagConnected ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetAddressType i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetIPAddress s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::agentInetPortNumber u 9999 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumber i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripName s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitNumber i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitPosition i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitName s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::slotNumber i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::tagID s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::bladeTagID s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledColor s EXA ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledMode i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledOperationMode i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitCount i 8 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripType i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripCascadePosition i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitRelativePosition i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumberOfRackUnits i 1

description: The user-defined name for the Device.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceName

description: The textual identification of the contact person
for this managed node, together with information
on how to contact this person.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysContact

description: An administratively-assigned name for this
managed node. By convention, this is the node's
fully-qualified domain name.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g.
`telephone closet, 3rd floor').
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation

description: The type of address format
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetAddressType

description: The current IP address. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates an error
or an unset option.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetIPAddress

description: The UDP port number used for accessing
the SNMP agent on the device.
Examples:
If the associated device MIB (PX2-MIB, EMD-MIB) has deviceCascadeType set to portForwarding, then
master: 50500
slave 1:50501
slave 2: 50502
If cascading mode is not portForwarding and default (Standard) ports are being used, then
port: 161
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::agentInetPortNumber

description: A unique value for each asset strip. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of assetStripCount.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumber

description: Asset management strip name.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripName

description: A unique value for each rack unit. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of rackUnitCount.
It corresponds with rackUnitID, the fixed ordinal
index of each rack unit.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitNumber

description: A number associated with each rack unit. Its value
depends on the rack unit numbering mode. It ranges
between 1 and the value of rackUnitCount.
If the asset strip is disconnected, then the value is 0.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitPosition

description: Name for a specific rackunit, may be feeely chosen.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitName

description: A unique value for each slot on a blade extension.
Value of 0 indicates a tag on the main strip.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::slotNumber

description: Asset management tag attached to the rack unit.
Empty in case there is no tag attached.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::tagID

description: Asset management tag attached to a blade extension at the rack unit.
Empty in case there is no tag attached.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::bladeTagID

description: Color of the LED (RGB) in binary format.
Setting this value automatically switches the ledOperationMode to manual.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledColor

description: Mode of the LED (on, off, fastBlink,slowBlink).
Setting this value automatically switches the ledOperationMode to manual.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledMode

description: Operation mode of the LED (manual or automatic, based on tag connection).
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledOperationMode

description: The number of rack-units for the asset management.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitCount

description: The asset strip type.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripType

description: This is the position of the asset Strip
in a cascaded chain. Numbered in ascending
order starting with the asset strip
connected to the device (EMX/PX).
For non-cascaded asset strips, value = 1
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripCascadePosition

description: This is the relative position of the rackUnit
within the assetStrip. For cascaded asset
strips such as the AMS-M2-Z and AMS-M3-Z
it is numbered in ascending order starting
with the rackunit closest to the
asset strip edge with the connector.
For non-cascaded asset strips, value = 1
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitRelativePosition

description: For non-cascaded asset strips, value = rackUnitCount
For cascaded asset strips, it is the number of rack units in the asset Strip.
Examples: 2 forAMS-M2-Z, 3 for AMS-M3-Z.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumberOfRackUnits

description: The asset tag of a rack unit was disconnected.
bladeTagID is empty if the asset tag is not on a blade extension.

event.Summary: Asset tag ($v14) of rack unit $v10 diconnected

variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitRelativePosition

description: For non-cascaded asset strips, value = rackUnitCount
For cascaded asset strips, it is the number of rack units in the asset Strip.
Examples: 2 forAMS-M2-Z, 3 for AMS-M3-Z.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumberOfRackUnits

description: A blade extension has been disconnected from the rackunit.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::bladeExtensionDisconnected ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysContact s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetAddressType i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetIPAddress s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::agentInetPortNumber u 9999 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumber i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripName s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitNumber i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitPosition i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitName s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::tagID s EXAMPLE ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::bladeExtensionSize i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledColor s EXA ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledMode i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledOperationMode i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitCount i 8 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripType i 0 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripCascadePosition i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitRelativePosition i 1 ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumberOfRackUnits i 1

description: The user-defined name for the Device.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceName

description: The textual identification of the contact person
for this managed node, together with information
on how to contact this person.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysContact

description: An administratively-assigned name for this
managed node. By convention, this is the node's
fully-qualified domain name.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysName

description: The physical location of this node (e.g.
`telephone closet, 3rd floor').
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::sysLocation

description: The type of address format
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetAddressType

description: The current IP address. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates an error
or an unset option.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::deviceInetIPAddress

description: The UDP port number used for accessing
the SNMP agent on the device.
Examples:
If the associated device MIB (PX2-MIB, EMD-MIB) has deviceCascadeType set to portForwarding, then
master: 50500
slave 1:50501
slave 2: 50502
If cascading mode is not portForwarding and default (Standard) ports are being used, then
port: 161
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::agentInetPortNumber

description: A unique value for each asset strip. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of assetStripCount.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumber

description: Asset management strip name.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripName

description: A unique value for each rack unit. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of rackUnitCount.
It corresponds with rackUnitID, the fixed ordinal
index of each rack unit.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitNumber

description: A number associated with each rack unit. Its value
depends on the rack unit numbering mode. It ranges
between 1 and the value of rackUnitCount.
If the asset strip is disconnected, then the value is 0.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitPosition

description: Name for a specific rackunit, may be feeely chosen.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitName

description: Asset management tag attached to the rack unit.
Empty in case there is no tag attached.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::tagID

description: In case a blade extension is connected this returns the
number of slots on the extension.
If the asset strip is disconnected or no blade is connected,
then the value is 0.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::bladeExtensionSize

description: Color of the LED (RGB) in binary format.
Setting this value automatically switches the ledOperationMode to manual.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledColor

description: Mode of the LED (on, off, fastBlink,slowBlink).
Setting this value automatically switches the ledOperationMode to manual.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledMode

description: Operation mode of the LED (manual or automatic, based on tag connection).
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::ledOperationMode

description: The number of rack-units for the asset management.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitCount

description: The asset strip type.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripType

description: This is the position of the asset Strip
in a cascaded chain. Numbered in ascending
order starting with the asset strip
connected to the device (EMX/PX).
For non-cascaded asset strips, value = 1
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripCascadePosition

description: This is the relative position of the rackUnit
within the assetStrip. For cascaded asset
strips such as the AMS-M2-Z and AMS-M3-Z
it is numbered in ascending order starting
with the rackunit closest to the
asset strip edge with the connector.
For non-cascaded asset strips, value = 1
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::rackUnitRelativePosition

description: For non-cascaded asset strips, value = rackUnitCount
For cascaded asset strips, it is the number of rack units in the asset Strip.
Examples: 2 forAMS-M2-Z, 3 for AMS-M3-Z.
variables.name: ASSETMANAGEMENT-MIB::assetStripNumberOfRackUnits

description: Maximum number of supported tags on blade extension was reached.
The asset strip won't detect any new tags on blade extensions until
some are removed.

event.Summary: Supported tags on blade extension reached  maximum number
